column2: Description

column1: Did the subject have a rash?
column2: Did the subject being reported in this investigation have a rash?

column1: Rash onset occur within 21 days of entering USA

column1: Did the subject have a fever?

The units of measure of the highest measured temperature.  This would be either Fahrenheit or Celsius.

column1: Was laboratory testing done for measles?
column2: Was laboratory testing done to confirm a diagnosis of measles?
Epidemiologic interpretation of the type of test(s) performed for this case
Epidemiologic interpretation of the results of the tests performed for this case.

The technique or method used to perform the test and obtain the test results.
Date of specimen collection
The medium from which the specimen originated.

column2: Were clinical specimens sent to CDC laboratories for genotyping (molecular typing)?

What was the transmission setting where the measles was acquired?
What was the source of the measles infection?
Does the age of the case match or make sense for the transmission setting listed (i.e. A subject aged 80 probably would not have a transmission setting of child day care center.)?

column1: Is this case Epi-linked to another confirmed or probable case?
column2: Specify if this case is Epidemiologically-linked to another confirmed or probable case of measles?

column1: Is this case linked  to an international imported case either directly or within same chain of transmission?
column2: A "Yes" answer to this question denotes this case was infected  by another subject who acquired infection while outside of the U.S.

Date the subject returned from all travel

column1: Number of doses received BEFORE first birthday
column2: The number of doses of measles-containing vaccine the subject received before their first birthday.

column1: Number of doses received ON or AFTER first birthday
column2: The number of measles-containing vaccine doses the subject received on or after their first birthday.

column1: Reason for vaccinating before first (1st) birthday but not after
